item.title: Python Programming Language Influence Network Graph
item.description: Python is a high-level programming language with a design philosophy that emphasizes code readability. This network graph shows languages connected with Python through influence relations, i.e. languages that were influenced by or influenced Python. Mor

item.title: Computer Programming Languages Charts
item.description: Visualizations showing and comparing different aspects of computer programming languages.

item.title: Programming Languages Ranked by Wikimedia Sitelinks
item.description: This chart shows programming languages ranked by Wikimedia sitelinks, i.e. the number of Wikimedia projects with a wiki page for the language.

item.title: People & Organizations Creating Programming Languages
item.description: An alphabetical list of creators of programming languages listed on programminglanguages.info.

item.title: JavaScript Programming Language Influence Network Graph
item.description: JavaScript (JS) is the programming language of the World Wide Web. This network graph shows languages connected by influence relations, i.e. languages that were influenced by JavaScript or influenced JavaScript and JavaScript itself. More influential la

item.title: Ada Programming Language Influence Network Graph
item.description: Ada, named after Ada Lovelace, is a statically typed, imperative, and object-oriented programming language. This network graph shows 26 languages connected by influence relations, i.e. languages that were influenced by Ada or influenced Ada and Ada itself.

item.title: Programming Languages Influence Network 2021 - Light Background Poster by ramiro
item.description: A network graph showing 500 programming languages connected by 953 influence relations. Highly influential languages like Lisp, Smalltalk, C, Java, C++, Haskell and Python are shown as larger circles as compared to languages with less influence on others l

item.title: Programming Languages Influence Network 2021 - Dark Background Tapestry by ramiro
item.description: A network graph showing 500 programming languages connected by 953 influence relations. Highly influential languages like Lisp, Smalltalk, C, Java, C++, Haskell and Python are shown as larger circles as compared to languages with less influence on others l

item.title: Programming Languages Influence Ranking
item.description: This chart shows the most influential programming languages ranked by the number of other languages they influenced based on data from the Wikidata project.

item.title: Programming Languages Influence Network 2020 - Dark Background
item.description: A network graph showing 478 programming languages connected by 892 influence relations. Highly influential languages like Lisp, Smalltalk, C, Java, C++, Haskell and Python are shown as larger circles as compared to languages with less influence on others l
